articles.headline: Trump, a Week After Porter Resigned, Says He’s ‘Totally Opposed’ to Domestic Violence
articles.snippet: President Trump’s statement came as his chief of staff faced new questions about his handling of abuse claims against the staff secretary Rob Porter.
articles.abstract: President Trump’s statement came as his chief of staff faced new questions about his handling of abuse claims against the staff secretary Rob Porter.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — One week after Rob Porter, his staff secretary, resigned amid spousal abuse allegations, President Trump said on Wednesday that he was “totally opposed to domestic violence,” his first condemnation of the alleged conduct behind a scandal that has engulfed the White House.
articles.byline: By Julie Hirschfeld Davis, Maggie Haberman and Michael D. Shear

articles.headline: Death Toll Is at 17 and Could Rise in Florida School Shooting
articles.snippet: The gunman, armed with a semiautomatic AR-15 assault rifle, was a former student of the school who began his rampage shortly before dismissal time, the authorities said.
articles.abstract: The gunman, armed with a semiautomatic AR-15 assault rifle, was a former student of the school who began his rampage shortly before dismissal time, the authorities said.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARKLAND, Fla. — A heavily armed young man barged into his former high school about an hour northwest of Miami on Wednesday, opening fire on terrified students and teachers and leaving a death toll of 17 that could rise even higher, the authorities said.
articles.byline: By Audra D. S. Burch and Patricia Mazzei

articles.headline: Jacob Zuma’s Legacy Is a Weakened South Africa
articles.snippet: Jacob Zuma’s legacy includes a series of scandals, increased corruption, few successes and a loss of faith in Nelson Mandela’s party.
articles.abstract: Jacob Zuma’s legacy includes a series of scandals, increased corruption, few successes and a loss of faith in Nelson Mandela’s party.
articles.lead_paragraph: JOHANNESBURG — When President Jacob Zuma of South Africa resigned on Wednesday, he did not yield to South Africa’s voters, courts or opposition parties, but to his own party, the African National Congress.

articles.headline: As the Streaming Wars Heat Up, Ryan Murphy Cashes In
articles.snippet: The producer agreed to a $300 million Netflix deal months after Shonda Rhimes signed for $100 million and Apple and Amazon contributed to a manic market.
articles.abstract: The producer agreed to a $300 million Netflix deal months after Shonda Rhimes signed for $100 million and Apple and Amazon contributed to a manic market.
articles.lead_paragraph: The battle between the Hollywood establishment and the streaming-media giants has caused big changes in the entertainment industry in recent months, driving up the prices of major stars and series producers while leaving traditional companies in danger of losing relevance.

articles.headline: How $225,000 Can Help Secure a Pollution Loophole at Trump’s E.P.A.
articles.snippet: A Tennessee truck dealership lavished a local Republican congresswoman with campaign donations. It also sells “Make Trucks Great Again” caps.
articles.abstract: A Tennessee truck dealership lavished a local Republican congresswoman with campaign donations. It also sells “Make Trucks Great Again” caps.
articles.lead_paragraph: CROSSVILLE, Tenn. — The gravel parking lot at the Fitzgerald family’s truck dealership here in central Tennessee was packed last week with shiny new Peterbilt and Freightliner trucks, as well as a steady stream of buyers from across the country.

articles.headline: Meet Cyril Ramaphosa, South Africa’s New President and a Mandela Favorite
articles.snippet: Cyril Ramaphosa was a protégé of Nelson Mandela before becoming one of South Africa’s richest men. As president, he vows to address gaping inequality.
articles.abstract: Cyril Ramaphosa was a protégé of Nelson Mandela before becoming one of South Africa’s richest men. As president, he vows to address gaping inequality.
articles.lead_paragraph: JOHANNESBURG — Cyril Ramaphosa, who was sworn in Thursday as South Africa’s president, recently did what many politicians do at pivotal points in their careers.

articles.headline: F.C.C. Watchdog Looks Into Changes That Benefited Sinclair
articles.snippet: An investigation could lead to questions that the F.C.C. chairman, Ajit Pai, has so far tried to avoid answering in public.
articles.abstract: An investigation could lead to questions that the F.C.C. chairman, Ajit Pai, has so far tried to avoid answering in public.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Last April, the chairman of the Federal Communications Commission, Ajit Pai, led the charge for his agency to approve rules allowing television broadcasters to greatly increase the number of stations they own. A few weeks later, Sinclair Broadcasting announced a blockbuster $3.9 billion deal to buy Tribune Media — a deal those new rules made possible.

articles.headline: Trump’s Inaugural Committee Paid $26 Million to Firm of First Lady’s Adviser
articles.snippet: The committee, which raised a record $107 million, detailed its finances in a tax filing, revealing that it donated less than expected to charity.
articles.abstract: The committee, which raised a record $107 million, detailed its finances in a tax filing, revealing that it donated less than expected to charity.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s inaugural committee paid nearly $26 million to an event planning firm started by an adviser to the first lady, Melania Trump, while donating $5 million — less than expected — to charity, according to tax filings released on Thursday.
articles.byline: By Maggie Haberman and Kenneth P. Vogel
